title: Graublau Sans Web with Lucida sanserif
content:
Hi folks,

Web licensing issues aside, what do you think of this type combination I suggested on Friday (Graublau Sans Web with Lucida sanserif), and my typeset example?

Blog post:  
 [http://nicewebtype.com/notes/2009/05/22/nice-web-type-likes/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418215923/http:/nicewebtype.com/notes/2009/05/22/nice-web-type-likes/ "http://nicewebtype.com/notes/2009/05/22/nice-web-type-likes/")

Example:  
 [http://nicewebtype.com/fonts/graublau-sans-web/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418215923/http:/nicewebtype.com/fonts/graublau-sans-web/ "http://nicewebtype.com/fonts/graublau-sans-web/")

If we want web typography to be respected as a part of our art and craft, web typesetting deserves our fullest criticism – judging the work on aesthetic merits while accounting for available technologies.

Tim
author: Tim Brown

comments.content: If you're not sure where to start, consider (from the text in the example page itself) any of my claims about the two faces. Do you agree? Do you disagree? **Why?** Also, please criticize the typesetting of the example itself.
Umm.. That looks like Times New Roman.
Oh, duh. Wrong browser! Let me pull out Safari. One sec…
I like the bold weight a lot, for subheads like "A little gummy in boldface"

Thanks, Dan. I posted this same topic in General Discussions:  
 [http://typophile.com/node/58658](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418215923/http:/typophile.com/node/58658 "http://typophile.com/node/58658")

... let the conversation grow from there. :)
